question.title: Validate child object within a custom ConstraintValidator
question.body:
I have a custom jakarta ConstraintValidator to validate an object I receive on my spring api. It looks like this

  @Component
  @RequiredArgsConstructor
  public class MyValidator
      implements ConstraintValidator<MyConstraintInterface, MyObject> {

  @Override
  public void initialize(final MyConstraintInterface constraintAnnotation) {
    ConstraintValidator.super.initialize(constraintAnnotation);
  }

  @Override
  public boolean isValid(
      final MyObject myObject,
      final ConstraintValidatorContext constraintValidatorContext){
    ...
  }

public record MyObject(
    @Valid FirstChild childObject, ...)


public record FirstChild(
    @Valid @NotNull SecondChild childObject, ...)

The custom validator works well, however it looks like the @Valid annotation does not work on the SecondChild object as I expect, because when I pass a null SecondChild object, I does not trigger a validation error.

Am I missing something here ?

question_comments.body: How are you validating? Why isn't there an annotation on the MyObject record to trigger the validation? Have you used the proper @NotNull annotations (for us impossible to know as you didn't include imports and package statements.
Is it possible that problem caused by record? Did you tried regular classes instead?
